Understate: The claim may understate the level of opposition to Right-To-Work legislation among business executive respondents, as only 15 percent were in favor according to the survey.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only mentions the results of one survey conducted by Wisconsin Manufacturers & Commerce.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the survey conducted by Wisconsin Manufacturers & Commerce accurately represents the views of all business executive respondents.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the low level of support for Right-To-Work legislation among business executive respondents, such as the wording of the survey questions or the specific demographics of the respondents.
